nl_prompt: Update the labels table to include a json field called comments_description.

postgres: ALTER TABLE tbl_labels ADD COLUMN comments_description JSON;
mysql: ALTER TABLE tbl_labels ADD COLUMN comments_description JSON;

postgres: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM INFORMATION_SCHEMA.COLUMNS WHERE TABLE_NAME='tbl_labels' AND column_name='comments_description' AND data_type = 'json'
mysql: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM INFORMATION_SCHEMA.COLUMNS WHERE TABLE_NAME='tbl_labels' AND column_name='comments_description' AND data_type = 'json'

postgres: ALTER TABLE tbl_labels DROP COLUMN comments_description;
mysql: ALTER TABLE tbl_labels DROP COLUMN comments_description;

postgres: ALTER TABLE tbl_labels DROP COLUMN comments_description;
mysql: ALTER TABLE tbl_labels DROP COLUMN comments_description;

other.nl_prompt_base: Update the labels table to include a json type field called comments_description.

nl_prompt: Rename the content column in the tbl_posts table to post_content

postgres: ALTER TABLE tbl_posts RENAME COLUMN content TO post_content;
mysql: ALTER TABLE tbl_posts RENAME COLUMN content TO post_content;

postgres: ALTER TABLE tbl_posts RENAME COLUMN post_content TO content;
mysql: ALTER TABLE tbl_posts RENAME COLUMN post_content TO content;

postgres: ALTER TABLE tbl_posts RENAME COLUMN post_content TO content;
mysql: ALTER TABLE tbl_posts RENAME COLUMN post_content TO content;

nl_prompt: Create an Enumerated Type for Access Levels

postgres: ALTER TABLE tbl_tags ADD COLUMN access_level_enum VARCHAR(10) CHECK (access_level_enum IN ('Public', 'Private', 'Restricted'));
mysql: ALTER TABLE tbl_tags ADD COLUMN access_level_enum ENUM('Public', 'Private', 'Restricted');

postgres: SELECT count(*) FROM INFORMATION_SCHEMA.COLUMNS WHERE TABLE_NAME='tbl_tags' AND column_name='access_level_enum '
mysql: SELECT count(*) FROM INFORMATION_SCHEMA.COLUMNS WHERE TABLE_NAME='tbl_tags' AND column_name='access_level_enum '

postgres: ALTER TABLE tbl_tags DROP COLUMN IF EXISTS access_level_enum;
mysql: ALTER TABLE tbl_tags DROP COLUMN access_level_enum;

postgres: ALTER TABLE tbl_tags DROP COLUMN IF EXISTS access_level_enum;
mysql: ALTER TABLE tbl_tags DROP COLUMN access_level_enum;

other.nl_prompt_base: Create an Enumerated Type for Access Levels

nl_prompt: Add a Generated Column full_name to tbl_users. -- Store first name and last name concatenated

postgres: ALTER TABLE tbl_users ADD COLUMN full_name VARCHAR(255) GENERATED ALWAYS AS (first_name || ' ' || last_name) STORED;
mysql: ALTER TABLE tbl_users ADD COLUMN full_name VARCHAR(255) GENERATED ALWAYS AS (CONCAT(first_name, ' ', last_name)) STORED;

postgres: SELECT count(*) FROM INFORMATION_SCHEMA.COLUMNS WHERE TABLE_NAME='tbl_users' AND column_name='full_name'
mysql: SELECT count(*) FROM INFORMATION_SCHEMA.COLUMNS WHERE TABLE_NAME='tbl_users' AND column_name='full_name'

postgres: ALTER TABLE tbl_users DROP COLUMN IF EXISTS full_name;
mysql: ALTER TABLE tbl_users DROP COLUMN full_name;

postgres: ALTER TABLE tbl_users DROP COLUMN IF EXISTS full_name;
mysql: ALTER TABLE tbl_users DROP COLUMN full_name;

other.nl_prompt_base: Add a Generated Column full_name to tbl_users
other.nl_prompt_extra_context: Store first name and last name concatenated
